indications:
Indications symptomatic relief of gastro-intestinal disorders characterised by
smooth muscle spasm
name: DICYCLOVERINE HYDROCHLORIDE
breadcrumbs: 1.2 Antispasmodics and other drugs altering gut motility
cautions:
Cautions 
(From Antimuscarinics: British National Formulary)
Cautions Antimuscarinics should be used with caution in Down’s syndrome, in children and in the elderly; they should also be used with caution in gastro-oesophageal reflux disease, diarrhoea, ulcerative colitis, autonomic neuropathy, acute myocardial infarction, hypertension, conditions characterised by tachycardia (including hyperthyroidism, cardiac insufficiency, cardiac surgery), pyrexia, and in individuals susceptible to angle-closure glaucoma. Interactions: Appendix 1 (antimuscarinics).
doses: 10–20 mg 3 times daily; infant 6–24 months 5–10 mg 3–4 times daily, 15 minutes before feeds; child 2–12 years 10 mg 3 times daily
pregnancy:
Pregnancy not known to be harmful; manufacturer advises use
only if essential
